data.headline: S&P 500 slipped 0.06%, Dow edged up 0.02%, Nasdaq fell 0.17%, and Russell 2000 lagged with a 0.29% drop
bullets: Tech and chip stocks extended last week’s AI-driven selloff despite some intraday rebounds
ZIM Integrated Shipping surged after receiving a $4.2B buyout offer
General Mills slid following a cut to its 2026 guidance
Danaher, Masimo, and Rivian saw notable moves on earnings results and conference calls
Constellation Energy drew attention on AI-driven power demand themes
Munich Re announced 1,000 AI-linked job cuts, highlighting sector concerns
M&A speculation increased with Paramount/Skydance, renewed Warner Bros. interest, Blackstone’s pursuit of Champions Group, and Elliott’s stake in Norwegian Cruise Line
Traders monitored Fed balance-sheet discussions and earlier dovish commentary ahead of key PCE inflation, Q4 GDP, Fed minutes, jobs data, and major earnings reports
